Gwent is an old card game especially fancied by dwarfs. It represents the confrontation of two opposing armies. The players are generals and cards represent their units. Every player uses his own unique deck of cards. Decks can be created for each of the four factions: Monsters, Nilfgaardian Empire, Northern Kingdoms and Scoia\'tael. Each faction has unique cards which lead to different play styles. Moreover, there are cards that can be used for every faction. Your goal is to win two rounds out of three by having more strength than your opponent.

At the beginning of the first round each player draws ten cards from their deck. After drawing, you can discard two cards and draw a new card for each. This step is optional, discarded cards are put back into the deck. The beginning player is determined by flipping a coin.
The players place cards alternately. You have to play one card every round! If a player doesn\'t want to play a card, they have to pass and aren\'t allowed to play another card until the round has ended. When one player passes, their opponent can still play cards until they pass too. If one of the opponents uses up all of his cards, he has to pass.
A round ends when both players pass. The player with the highest total score wins the round. When both opponents have the same number of points, the round is seen as a win for both sides. All cards are moved to the discard pile at the end of each round. Your hand is reused in the next round—you don\'t draw new cards. The winner of the last round gets the first turn. Goal of the game is to win two rounds.

There are four factions: Monsters, Nilfgaardian Empire, Northern Kingdoms and Scoia\'tael. Every faction has got unique cards, leaders and perks. Moreover, there are some additional cards that are neutral and can be used in every faction.

Leader of monster faction is Eredin Bréacc Glas, also known as Sparrowhawk who is the King of the Wild Hunt. Their perk is iron skin which makes it possible to keep one unit at the end of each round.
Emhyr var Emreis, also known as \"The White Flame Dancing on the Barrows of his Enemies\", is emperor of Nilfgaard. Treachery causes any player with a nilfgaardian deck to win if points draw level.
Archenemy of Nilfgaard is Foltest, King of Temeria and leader of the Northern Kingdoms faction. They are able to draw one card after a won round.
In their fight, the Northern Kingdoms try to decimate Nonhumans which are represented by the Scoia\'tael faction. Scoia\'tael players may decide who gets the first turn in the first round. They are led by Francesca Findabair, also known as Enid an Gleanna (Daisy of the Valleys).

Each faction has certain leaders with different abilities. They are listed here.

Monsters: Eredin Bréacc Glas

The Treacherous:
Passive - Doubles the strength of all spy cards (affects both players).

Bringer of Death:
Restore a card from your discard pile to your hand.

Commander of the Red Riders:
Double the strength of all your Close combat units (unless a Commander\'s horn is also present in that row).

King of the Wild Hunt:
Pick any weather card from your deck and play it instantly.

Destroyer of Worlds:
Discard two cards and draw one card of your choice from your deck.

Nilfgaardian Empire: Emhyr var Emreis

The Relentless:
Draw a card from your opponent\'s discard pile.

The White Flame:
Cancel your opponent\'s Leader Ability.

Invader of the North:
Abilities that restore a unit to the battlefield restore a randomly-chosen unit. Affects both players.

Emperor of Nilfgaard:
Look at three random cards from your opponent\'s hand.

His Imperial Majesty:
Pick a Torrential Rain card from your deck and play it instantly.

Northern Kingdoms: Foltest

The Steel-Forged:
Destroy your enemy\'s strongest Siege unit(s) if the combined strength of all their Siege units is 10 or more.

Lord Commander of the North:
Clear any weather effects (resulting from Biting Frost, Torrential Rain or Impenetrable Fog cards) in play.

The Siegesmaster:
Doubles the strength of all your Siege units (unless a Commander\'s Horn is also present on that row).

King of Temeria:
Pick an Impenetrable Fog card from your deck and play it instantly.

Son of Medell:
Destroy your enemy\'s strongest Ranged combat unit(s) if the combined strength of all their Ranged combat units is 10 or more.

Scoia\'tael: Francesca Findabair

Daisy of the Valley:
Draw an extra card at the beginning of the battle.

Hope of the Aen Seidhe:
Move agile units to whichever valid row maximizes their strength (don\'t move units already in optimal row).

Queen of Dol Blathanna:
Destroy your enemy\'s strongest Close combat unit(s) if the combined strength of all their Close combat units is 10 or more.

The Beautiful:
Doubles the strength of all your Ranged combat units (unless a Commander\'s Horn is also present on that row).

Pureblood Elf:
Pick a Biting Frost card from your deck and play it instantly.

There are three major types of cards: Leaders, units and Special Cards. Each deck has one leader card. It has a certain ability which can be activated once per game.
Moreover, there are at least 22 Unit Cards including Heroes. Heroes are immune to any boost or weakening. Units are played in turns. Each player has got three combat rows, one for Close combat, Ranged combat and Siege units each. It can be seen on the cards which row must be used.
Also there are Special Cards (maximum 10), \"Decoy\", \"Scorch\", \"Commander\'s Horn\" and weather cards. Weather cards are placed in a separate section of the board because they influence both players equally. Commander\'s Horn is placed at the designated combat row.

Some unit cards have got special abilities which are explained in the following.

Spy:
Must be placed on your opponent\'s battlefield (and counts toward your opponent\'s total score), and allows you to draw 2 cards extra from your deck.

Tight Bond:
When placed next to a card with the same name, double the strength of both cards.

Muster:
When played, automatically find any cards with the same name in your deck and play them instantly.

Morale Boost:
When played, add +1 strength to all other units in the row it is played in.

Medic:
Allow you to choose one card from your discard pile and play it instantly (no Heroes or Special Cards). Agile units have to be placed in the combat row they have been in before.

Commander\'s Horn:
Double the strength of all other units in this combat row.

Agile:
Can be placed in either the Close combat or the Ranged combat row. They cannot be moved once placed.

Scorch:
Kill the strongest card(s) in the specified row of the enemy.

Summon Avenger:
Summon a powerful new unit card to take their place when they are removed from the battlefield.

Special Cards can be played instead of Unit Cards and trigger certain effects which are listed below.

Biting Frost:
Sets all Close combat units to strength 1 for both players.

Impenetrable Fog:
Sets all Ranged combat units to strength 1 for both players.

Torrential Rain:
Sets all Siege units to strength 1 for both players.

Clear Weather:
Removes all weather effects.

Decoy:
Swap with a card on the battlefield.

Commander\'s Horn:
Doubles the strength of the selected row.

Scorch:
Discard after playing. Kills the strongest card(s) on the battlefield.

Thanks for installing \"Gwent - A Calculator\"! Please note that this app is made to support you in playing Gwent using analog cards by calculating your points. This app does not allow you to play Gwent against AI or without analog cards!

So if you didn\'t do so yet: Print out a deck of Gwent cards (guidance here) and find an opponent who does the same (both of you need to install this app).

Your game board consists of three combat rows: Close combat, Ranged combat and Siege row (left to right). These rows contain unit cards. Each of them can be weakened by certain weather cards or boosted by a Commander\'s Horn.

Combat rows consist of the following parts:

1: Overall strength of all units placed in this row.

2: The current weather (can be changed by tapping).

3: The boost of a Commander\'s Horn (can be changed by tapping).

4: Number of units in this combat row (you can add or remove units by tapping).

Next to the game board there is a menu providing useful functions:

1: Overall strength of all units

2: Change faction

3: Reset board

4: Clear weather

5: Scorch strongest unit(s)

6: Coin-flip

7: Settings

More information on Gwent and its rules can be found in the settings. There you can repeat this introduction too!

But first: Have fun with analog Gwent! Please use the Google Play Store or GitHub to share improvement suggestions, bugs and other feedback with me!
